name: Cairns
fun_fact: Fun fact: Cairns is the gateway to the Great Barrier Reef and has a thriving craft beer scene with breweries creating 'tropical ales' specifically designed to be refreshing in the humid climate. Some breweries even donate profits to reef conservation!

hero_dishes.name: Barramundi and Reef Fish
hero_dishes.description: Fresh local barramundi and reef fish, flame-grilled or pan-seared, showcasing Queensland's pristine waters. Often served with tropical fruit salsas.
hero_dishes.origin_story: Barramundi is a prized Australian native fish, and Cairns' proximity to both the reef and tropical waters means access to the freshest catch.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Dundee's on the Waterfront for fresh local seafood and flame-grilled specialties; Ochre Restaurant for modern Australian preparations with native ingredients

hero_dishes.name: Modern Australian Bushfood
hero_dishes.description: Innovative dishes using native Australian ingredients like kangaroo, crocodile, and Gulf of Carpentaria bugs, prepared with modern techniques.
hero_dishes.origin_story: Chef Craig Squire at Ochre pioneered modern Australian cuisine in Cairns since 1994, introducing bushfood to fine dining.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Ochre Restaurant for kangaroo satays in macadamia sauce, octopus with lemon myrtle chimichurri, or bugs with papaya coconut salsa; Dundee's for kangaroo and crocodile specialties

hero_dishes.name: Atherton Tablelands Beef
hero_dishes.description: Premium steaks sourced from Cairns' backyard cattle stations on the fertile Atherton Tablelands, served with grilled bone marrow.
hero_dishes.origin_story: The Atherton Tablelands' rich volcanic soil and ideal climate produce some of Australia's finest beef, right in Cairns' backyard.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: CC's Bar and Grill (award-winning, famous for steak); NOA for innovative preparations using Tablelands produce

signature_drinks.name: Tropical Craft Beer
signature_drinks.description: Locally brewed ales and lagers designed for drinking in the tropics - crisp, refreshing, unfiltered and preservative-free.
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Head to Coral Sea Brewing Co. for their Tropic Ale or Tropic Lager (available throughout Cairns); Hemingway's Brewery for '7th Heaven' pale ale (profits support Great Barrier Reef conservation); Macalister Brewing in Smithfield for unpasteurised, naturally conditioned beers

signature_drinks.name: Tropical Gin
signature_drinks.description: Award-winning gins crafted with tropical botanicals like mango, finger lime, lemon myrtle, and macadamia from the region.
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Try Wolf Lane Distillery's Tropical Gin with 13 local botanicals; Narrow Tracks Distillery's signature Dry Gin made with Queensland sugarcane; Mt Uncle Distillery for native botanical spirits

food_culture_notes: Cairns showcases the best of reef-to-table seafood and rainforest-to-plate produce
Many restaurants champion Tablelands-grown fruit, dairy, and Outback cattle station beef
Native Australian ingredients like kangaroo, emu, crocodile are menu staples, not tourist gimmicks
The craft beer scene emphasizes sustainability and tropical refreshment
Multicultural influences from British colonial, Asian, and indigenous Australian cultures
